lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/gui/components.Light.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run components.Light.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.

ui.beautifyMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n" +

new AssertCommand(tasks, ui, storage).assertExecute(tasks, ui, storage);
String reply = ui.beautifyMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber) + "\nNow you have " + (tasks.size() - 1) + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to exit the program.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage, TaskListHistory taskListHistory) {
new AssertCommand(tasks, ui, storage).assertExecute(tasks, ui, storage);
return ui.beautifyMessage(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Represents a command to mark a task as done or undone.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be marked.
* @param isMark     True if the task is to be marked as done, false if it is to be marked as undone.
* Marks the task as done or undone and updates the storage file.
* @throws LightException if an error occurs during execution
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage, TaskListHistory taskListHistory) throws LightException {
new AssertCommand(tasks, ui, storage).assertExecute(tasks, ui, storage);
reply = ui.beautifyMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber));
reply = ui.beautifyMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as undone:\n" + tasks.get(taskNumber));

return ui.beautifyMessage("Got it. I've redone the last command.\n" + stringOfTask);
